page.title: 18SUTTON'S PUBLIC HOUSE
page.content: The John O'Gaunt public house was built around the year 1700.It was named after John O'Gaunt,Duke of Lancaster (1340-1399). The pub belongs to Green King Breweries plc of St.Neot's.The beer is made at their brewery in Biggleswade. The pub is open between 11am and 2.30pm and from 7pm until 11pm .Meals are only obtainable at lunchtimes. About 80 people visit the pub every day.They come from surrounding towns of Potton,Sandy, Biggleswade and Wrestlingworth as well as Sutton. Many teams meet at the pub.They have dominoes,crib,quiz,darts,cricket, rugby and golf teams.Seven people work in the pub including the manager.There are 2 bars and a garden which is enjoyed by many people in the summer months.
